pros: Flexible working, great colleagues to work with

pros:

pros: Lovely team and people, supportive environment, focus on learning
cons: Somewhat on your own for getting research funding

pros:
Good salary
Small organisation and team so easier to work with each other
cons:
Its an academic institution but it works more like a corporate organisation.
Lack of transparency and trust between managers and employees.
They oversell work from home while making the offer, but don't like it much when employees actually work from home.
They spend a lot of their resources on non research staff , which could actually be used for actually doing some useful research.

review_title: A good organisation to work with but poor guidance
pros:
-A global organisation
-Experienced researchers
-Has been in the field since quite some time
cons:
-Lack of proper guidance and mentoring
-Cannot develop full potential of employees
-Strategies change very frequently

review_title: Best public health research organisation in India
pros: Small and efficient administration, professional and flexible work culture, big pusher in capacity building own staff
cons: None that I can think of. Very good work culture.

pros: Great place, team spirit, positive growth, professionalism, peer support, go getters, innovative, brainstorming
cons: There are no cons as such that I would happen to know of mentioning here

pros: Ethics, support & excellent work environment with open door policy.
cons: a young company in India, still in the process of building systems.

pros: Satisfied with the work culture, nature of work.
cons: planning needs to be fine tuned.
